markdownRemark.html:
javascript (node)

well, I know javascript so this one was more for calibration purposes. it took me less than a minute to do it.

haskell

30 mins, not easy at all completely different way of thinking, knowning some of the concepts helped

rust

10 mins, not that hard cool pattern matching the compile time is real (on hackerrank)

python

1 minute easy

ada

15 mins reminded me of Pascal not that hard, weird syntax for declaring variables though

go

5 mins not bad for languages that I know or are not that different, it's kind of repetititve, so we're going to spice it up

at this point i realized I have come up with a system and broken the problem down into the smallest parts:

  • how to do a for loop (which most often comes with how to print as well whcih is handy)
  • how to do modulos operator
  • elseif

brainfuck

go bash brainfuck elyxir
